changeSet.comment: Update TM database version number

changeSet.comment: Now campaigns and iterations have a reference too

column.name: REFERENCE
column.remarks: a reference lavel for a campaign

column.name: REFERENCE
column.remarks: a reference lavel for an iteration

changeSet.author: bsiri
changeSet.comment: creating a view that helps querying on all the issues reported in an execution because querying EXECUTION and EXECUTION_STEP separately is just a pain in the ass.
changeSet.createView: select exec.execution_id, issue.issue_id from EXECUTION exec inner join ISSUE issue on exec.issue_list_id = issue.issue_list_id UNION select eesteps.execution_id, issue.issue_id from EXECUTION_EXECUTION_STEPS eesteps inner join EXECUTION_STEP estep on eesteps.execution_step_id = estep.execution_step_id inner join ISSUE issue on estep.issue_list_id = issue.issue_list_id

changeSet.author: jsimon, bsiri
changeSet.comment: The table CHART_QUERY aggregates 1..* CHART_MEASURE_COLUMN, 1..* CHART_AXIS_COLUMN and 0..* CHART_FILTER (see these table for more informations). It may be referenced by either a CHART_DEFINITION (as a query), either a COLUMN_PROTOTYPE (as a subquery).

column.name: CHART_QUERY_ID
column.remarks: autogenerated ID

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: internal usage, when this CHART_QUERY is a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE subquery the name helps identify which one

column.name: STRATEGY
column.remarks: says how the query builder should integrate this query to a main query. Accepts values : MAIN, SUBQUERY or INLINED

column.name: JOIN_STYLE
column.remarks: generally indicate whether should use inner join or left join when a natural join is possible. Possible values : INNER_JOIN or LEFT_JOIN

changeSet.comment: The table CHART_DEFINITION describes the custom charts created by the user. Along with the informations stored in this table a CHART_DEFINITION refers to a CHART_QUERY, which aggregates the unit blocks that constitute the data elligible for plotting.

column.name: CHART_ID
column.remarks: autogenerated ID

column.name: USER_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to the owner of this chart definition

column.name: QUERY_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to a CHART_QUERY

column.name: NAME
column.remarks: The name of this chart

column.name: VISIBILITY
column.remarks: whether this chart is 'PRIVATE' or 'PUBLIC'

column.name: CHART_TYPE
column.remarks: whether this chart is a 'PIE', 'BAR' etc

column.name: DESCRIPTION
column.remarks: additional informations about this chart

column.name: PROJECT_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers le projet.

changeSet.comment:
This table holds referential data only (users cannot populate it) : it lists every single columns that can be used in a custom chart. Here, a column is basically an attribute from an entity. Theses columns are merely options proposed to the user. Once the user confirmed that he wants to include a particular column in a custom chart, and in which context (as a measure, an axis or applying a filter on it), the entries from this table will be referenced by entries in tables FILTER, AXIS_COLUMN or MEASURE_COLUMN.
Some columns aren't proper attributes of an entity but rather the result of an expression. This expression is itself expressed as a CHART_QUERY. For this reason a COLUMN_PROTOTYPE may point to a CHART_QUERY via a (nullable) foreign key.
Last, some columns aren't supposed to be available to the user and used in a chart. The attribute 'BUSINESS' = true indicates that the user is allowed to use them.

column.name: CHART_COLUMN_ID
column.remarks: the column ID

column.name: COLUMN_TYPE
column.remarks: complementary information about the nature of this column : native attribute ('ATTRIBUTE'), computed field ('CALCULATED') - often as a subquery -, or custom field ('CUF')

column.name: SUBQUERY_ID
column.remarks: optional foreign key to a (sub) CHART_QUERY

column.name: LABEL
column.remarks: The default label for this column.

column.name: ENTITY_TYPE
column.remarks: The kind of entities this column belongs to

column.name: ENTITY_ROLE
column.remarks: a complementary qualifier for ENTITY_TYPE, used when an entity has an auxialiary role regarding another entity. For instance an InfoListItem may have a role of nature for a TestCase, or category for a RequirementVersion. May be null if nothing special about it.

column.name: ATTRIBUTE_NAME
column.remarks: The name of the attribute of the entity

column.name: DATA_TYPE
column.remarks: Data type of the attribute

column.name: BUSINESS
column.remarks: tells whether this column is public or internal.

column.name: ATTRIBUTE_TYPE
column.remarks: complementary information about the nature of this column : native attribute ('ATTRIBUTE'), computed field ('CALCULATED') - often as a subquery -, or custom field ('CUF')

changeSet.comment: The CHART_COLUMN_ROLES precises in which roles a particular CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE can be used : 'AXIS', 'FILTER' or 'MEASURE'.

column.name: CHART_COLUMN_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE

column.name: ROLE
column.remarks: name of a role for the referenced column

changeSet.comment: This table store which columns are the measures the user is interested to see. They consists of an aggregation operation applied to a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE.

column.name: CHART_COLUMN_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to the CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE this measure applies to

column.name: QUERY_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to a CHART_QUERY

column.name: LABEL
column.remarks: a label for this measure. Will override the default label of the column prototype if non null.

column.name: MEASURE_OPERATION
column.remarks: the measure applied to the column

column.name: MEASURE_RANK
column.remarks: the order in which the measure will be displayed when the chart is rendered.

changeSet.comment: A CHART_FILTER restricts the values a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE may have for a given chart. A CHART_FILTER will compare the value of a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE with one or several CHART_FILTER_VALUES using a comparison operator.

column.name: FILTER_ID
column.remarks: autogenerated ID

column.name: CHART_COLUMN_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to a CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE

column.name: QUERY_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to a CHART_QUERY

column.name: FILTER_OPERATION
column.remarks: a comparison operator

changeSet.comment: This table holds the values used in a CHART_FILTER.

column.name: FILTER_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to CHART_FILTER

column.name: FILTER_VALUE
column.remarks: a value for this filter

changeSet.comment: This table holds which CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE are the axes for a given chart.

column.name: CHART_COLUMN_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE

column.name: QUERY_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to a CHART_QUERY

column.name: LABEL
column.remarks: a label for this axis. If non null, will override the default label in the CHART_COLUMN_PROTOTYPE

column.name: AXIS_OPERATION
column.remarks: may define an additional operation about how data are grouped on this axis, most of the time 'NONE' is fine, however for Timestamp columns an adequate aggregation (day, month etc) may be useful

column.name: AXIS_RANK
column.remarks: in which order the axis are processed (if relevant)

changeSet.comment: The scope is a particular filter on the data : it restrict the perimeter from which the measured entities can be chosen, for example from project X and folder Y

column.name: CHART_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to a CHART_DEFINITION

column.name: ENTITY_REFERENCE_TYPE
column.remarks: the type of the referenced entity

column.name: ENTITY_REFERENCE_ID
column.remarks: the id of the referenced entity

changeSet.author: bsiri
changeSet.comment: populate the column prototype referential data (generated from src/main/script/MakeChartColumns.groovy)

changeSet.author: jthebault

column.name: CRL_ID
column.remarks: pk genere

column.name: ATTACHMENT_LIST_ID
column.remarks: FK to ATTACHMENT_LIST

column.name: CRLN_ID
column.remarks: pk genere

column.name: CRL_ID
column.remarks: fk to the containing CUSTOM_REPORT_LIBRARY

changeSet.comment: This table contains the relations between two custom reports nodes. If a node is root, parent id will be null and descendant id will be itself. a given node can be referenced as descendant only one time so we can map the join with hibernate

column.name: ANCESTOR_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers le noeud parent

column.name: DESCENDANT_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers l'element fils.

column.name: CONTENT_ORDER
column.remarks: numro d'ordre du noeud dans son parent

column.name: CRF_ID
column.remarks: pk genere

column.name: PROJECT_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers le projet.

column.name: CRD_ID
column.remarks: pk genere

column.name: PROJECT_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers le projet.

column.name: CRCB_ID
column.remarks: pk genere

column.name: CRD_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers le dashboard.

column.name: CHART_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers le chart.

column.name: CRL_ID
column.remarks: FK FOR CUSTOM_REPORT_LIBRARY.CRL_ID

column.name: TMP_CRL_ID
column.remarks: TMP FK FOR CUSTOM_REPORT_LIBRARY.CRL_ID

changeSet.comment: closure table for custom report library nodes. Its content is set and modified by four triggers

column.name: ANCESTOR_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers le noeud parent. La relation est parfois d'un noeud vers lui meme.

column.name: DESCENDANT_ID
column.remarks: cle etrangere vers l'element fils. La relation est parfois d'un noeud vers lui meme.

column.name: DEPTH
column.remarks: stores how deep is the descendant element nested in the subtree of the ancestor element

changeSet.author: jthebault
changeSet.comment: postgresql-triggers for CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE table

changeSet.author: jthebault
changeSet.comment: h2-triggers for CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE table
changeSet.sql: create trigger ins_crln_after after insert on CUSTOM_REPORT_LIBRARY_NODE for each row call "org.squashtest.csp.h2.triggers.CRLNAfterInsert";
create trigger del_crln_before before delete on CUSTOM_REPORT_LIBRARY_NODE for each row call "org.squashtest.csp.h2.triggers.CRLNBeforeDelete";
create trigger attach_crln_after after insert on CRLN_RELATIONSHIP for each row call "org.squashtest.csp.h2.triggers.CRLNAfterAttach";
create trigger detach_crln_before before delete on CRLN_RELATIONSHIP for each row call "org.squashtest.csp.h2.triggers.CRLNBeforeDetach";

changeSet.author: jthebault
changeSet.comment: mysql-triggers for CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE table
changeSet.sql: create trigger ins_crln_after after insert on CUSTOM_REPORT_LIBRARY_NODE for each row insert ignore into CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE values (new.crln_id, new.crln_id, 0);
create trigger del_crln_before before delete on CUSTOM_REPORT_LIBRARY_NODE for each row delete from CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE where ancestor_id=old.crln_id and descendant_id=old.crln_id;

create trigger attach_crln_after after insert on CRLN_RELATIONSHIP for each row insert ignore into CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE select c1.ancestor_id, c2.descendant_id, c1.depth+c2.depth+1 from CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE c1 cross join CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE c2 where c1.descendant_id = new.ancestor_id and c2.ancestor_id = new.descendant_id;

create trigger detach_crln_before before delete on CRLN_RELATIONSHIP for each row delete clos1 from CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE clos1 join CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE clos2 on clos1.descendant_id=clos2.descendant_id left join CRLN_RELATIONSHIP_CLOSURE clos3 on clos3.ancestor_id = clos2.ancestor_id and clos3.descendant_id = clos1.ancestor_id where clos2.ancestor_id = old.descendant_id and clos3.ancestor_id is null;

changeSet.author: jthebault
changeSet.comment: Migration for custom report workspace evolution. Mainly create the Library entities and their nodes, attachement list...
changeSet.sql: update CUSTOM_REPORT_LIBRARY_NODE set NAME = ( select p.NAME from PROJECT p where ENTITY_ID = p.CRL_ID ) where ENTITY_TYPE = 'LIBRARY';

changeSet.author: bsiri
changeSet.comment: This table holds the optional extension for requirement, that flags them as synchronized requirement

column.name: REQ_SYNC_ID
column.remarks: autogenerated key

column.name: REQUIREMENT_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to the (now synchronized) requirement

column.name: BUGTRACKER_ID
column.remarks: foreign key to the source bugtracker

column.name: REMOTE_REQ_ID
column.remarks: ID of the remote requirement

column.name: REMOTE_PROJECT_ID
column.remarks: ID of the remote project that hosts the remote requirement

column.name: REMOTE_REQ_URL
column.remarks: the url of the remote requirement

column.name: LAST_SYNCHRONIZED_BY
column.remarks: the last used that synchronized that requirement with the remote manager

changeSet.author: bsiri
changeSet.comment: adding a column recording how a requirement should be managed

column.name: MODE
column.remarks: Says whether a requirement is NATIVE or SYNCHRONIZED
